content: fuss free fingerless mitts by pat hensley when we go hiking i like to have something to keep my hands warm while i use my hiking sticks but i want my fingers free to take photos with my phone camera i wanted something that didn t have a lot of pattern in it and was fast and easy to knit up so i had to cast these on they are pretty simple and easy to knit i think a beginner would be able to make these materials 30 40 grams/130 -150 yards of fingering/sock weight yarn us 1 2 25 mm or size required to achieve gauge depending on your preferred way of knitting small circumferences in the round you will need either a set of 5 dpns two small circulars or one long circular for magic loop stitch markers difficulty easy to medium gauge 31stitches and 38 row = 10cm/4inches abbreviations used k - knit stitch ktbl knit through the back loop p - purl m1 make 1 increase pm place marker sm - slip marker bor beginning of round pattern and photos © 2024 pat hensley all rights reserved for personal use only techniques used cast on knitting in the round knit and purl stitches make 1 increase putting stitches on a stitch holder picking up a stitch bind off notes and easy stockinette mitt with twisted ribbed cuffs easy to add length if desired you can use your choice of increasing a stitch i like to use the backwards loop https //www purlsoho com/create/make-1-backwards-loop/ right- and left-hand directions both are the same cuff cast on 60 stitches join in the round be careful not to twist place bor marker rounds 1 15 twisted ribbing *ktbl p1 repeat from * to end of round rounds 16 35 knit to end of round 20 rounds thumb gusset round 36 knit 4 pm knit to end of round round 37 m1 knit to marker m1 sm knit to end of round increase 2 stitches round 38 knit to end of round *repeat round 37 and 38 until you have20 total thumb stitches put 20 stitches on stitch holders hand rounds 39 58 knit 20 row or to desired length top of hand rounds 59 -
